intro: Mentha noeana, commonly known as the Greek mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and appear in clusters at the ends of the stems. Mentha noeana is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine and culinary applications.
